security_audit.summary: All static analysis findings are false positives. The skill contains only markdown documentation with instructions for integrating a React component library. Backtick patterns detected are markdown formatting, not shell execution. Environment variable access (process.env.NODE_ENV) is standard development-mode detection. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Add Visual Feedback Toolbar to Next.js
content.value_statement: Collect structured visual feedback from stakeholders directly on your Next.js application. Agentation adds a floating toolbar that lets team members annotate screenshots and submit detailed bug reports without leaving the browser.
actual_capabilities: Install the Agentation npm package in a Next.js project
Detect whether App Router or Pages Router is being used
Add the Agentation component to the appropriate layout file
Configure conditional rendering for development environment only
Verify existing installations to prevent duplicate setup
limitations: Component only renders in development mode by default

use_cases.title: Enable Stakeholder Feedback

use_cases.title: Streamline Bug Reporting

use_cases.title: Client Review Sessions
use_cases.description: Agencies can give clients an easy way to mark up staging sites during review cycles, reducing back-and-forth communication.

best_practices: Always wrap the Agentation component in a NODE_ENV check to prevent it from loading in production
Verify existing installation before attempting to install to avoid duplicate setup
Use the appropriate layout file based on whether your project uses App Router or Pages Router
anti_patterns: Do not remove the NODE_ENV check as this will expose the toolbar in production builds
Avoid installing multiple versions of Agentation by checking package.json first
Do not add Agentation to individual pages instead of the root layout

faq.question: What is Agentation?
faq.answer: Agentation is a visual feedback toolbar that floats on your web application, allowing users to annotate screenshots and submit structured feedback for AI coding agents.

faq.question: Does Agentation work in production?
faq.answer: By default, the skill configures Agentation to only render in development mode using process.env.NODE_ENV checks. This prevents the toolbar from appearing in production builds.

faq.question: Which Next.js router types are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports both Next.js App Router (app directory) and Pages Router (pages directory). It automatically detects which router your project uses.

faq.question: What are the requirements for using Agentation?
faq.answer: Agentation requires React 18 or higher and is designed for Next.js projects. It works out of the box with no additional configuration needed.

faq.question: How do I know if Agentation is working?
faq.answer: After setup, run your development server and look for a floating button in the bottom-right corner of your application. This is the Agentation toolbar.

faq.question: Can I customize when Agentation appears?
faq.answer: Yes, you can modify the conditional rendering logic. The default setup uses process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' but you can adjust this to any condition that fits your workflow.
